rules.rule: Helmholtz stripe effect follows sigmoid transition centered at W:H=0.52
rules.formula: sigmoid = 1 / (1 + exp(-(wh_ratio - 0.52) * 6.0)); effect = -5.8 + sigmoid * (15.37 - (-5.8))

rules.rule: Duty cycle modifier for stripe effects
rules.formula: duty_cycle_modifier = 0.6 + 0.4 * stripe_duty_cycle
rules.evidence: Thompson 2011: duty cycle 0.9 -> ~10% effect; duty cycle 0.1 -> ~4%

rules.rule: Comparison baseline reduction: H-stripes vs plain garment reduces effect by 70%
rules.formula: if baseline == 'none': effect *= 0.3
rules.evidence: Thompson Exp 3: horizontal vs PLAIN -> effect ~0 for moderate bodies

rules.rule: 3D viewing amplifies stripe effect by 1.84x
rules.formula: if viewing_3D: effect *= 1.84
rules.evidence: Thompson: 3D mannequin 10.7% vs 2D drawing 5.8%

rules.rule: Oppel-Kundt filler curve is non-monotonic: peaks at 8-12 fillers then declines
rules.formula: Inverted-U curve with maximum at 11-13 equispaced fillers (Wackermann 2010)

rules.rule: Luminance additive component: darker garment independently slims
rules.formula: luminance_effect = -3.5 * (1 - garment_luminance_normalized)

rules.rule: Stripe width: narrow stripes amplify Helmholtz more than wide stripes
rules.evidence: Thompson 2011: duty cycle 0.9 (narrow lines, wide gaps) -> up to 10.1%; 0.1 -> ~4%

rules.rule: Bright horizontal stripes on dark garment maximize perceived widening
rules.formula: irradiation expansion: +5-10% per stripe edge * stripe count; Oppel-Kundt: +3-7% at 8-12 stripes; Combined: +5-12%

rules.rule: Luminance-width relationship follows saturating sigmoid curve
rules.formula: sigmoid = 1/(1+exp(-0.08*(L_star-35))); if sigmoid<0.5: effect = -1.5*(1-2*sigmoid); else: effect = 0.8*(2*sigmoid-1)

rules.rule: Background luminance multiplier: dark backgrounds amplify slimming 7x
rules.evidence: Koutsoumpis Exp 3: dark bg 1.33% vs light bg 0.19% (7x ratio)

rules.rule: Body-width proportionality correction: wider bodies get smaller % slimming
rules.formula: width_correction = reference_width_ratio / body_width_ratio; reference = 0.40
rules.evidence: Edge contraction is absolute; % decreases for wider bodies

rules.rule: On white e-commerce background (L*=100), luminance slimming is near zero (0.19%, not significant, p=0.38)
On dark background (L*=30), luminance slimming is meaningful (1.33%, d=1.27, p<0.001)
Red rated as slim as black despite higher L* — hue anomaly
rules.evidence: Sidhu 2021: red attracted slimmer body size ratings similar to black

rules.rule: Grey perceived wider than white despite lower L* — hue anomaly
rules.evidence: Sidhu 2021: grey/green rated as making body appear LARGER than white
rules.score_note: Proves hue/saturation/psychological associations independently modulate perceived size

rules.rule: Monochromatic dressing (unbroken vertical column) reduces perceived width by ~1.5-5.0%
rules.formula: HVI on full outfit -> 5-10% height overestimation -> 1.5-5.0% width reduction via reciprocity factor (0.3-0.5% per 1%)

rules.rule: Color break at waist splits column, reducing height overestimation by 40-60%
rules.formula: Effective widening at break zone: +1-3% relative to monochromatic

rules.rule: Skin-garment contrast modifier: high contrast sharpens body boundary (+width), low blends (-width)
rules.formula: When deltaL > 60: +0.5-1.5% width. When deltaL < 30: boundary less salient. Net: < ±0.5%

rules.rule: Luminance contribution to Oppel-Kundt is 20-33% of total effect
rules.evidence: Wackermann 2012

rules.rule: Polarity asymmetry: bright-on-dark STRONGER expansion than dark-on-bright
rules.evidence: Wackermann 2012: negative polarity (bright on dark) = stronger Oppel-Kundt

rules.rule: Müller-Lyer effect peaks at ~30 degree fin angle with 15-18% elongation (wings-out)
rules.formula: See muller_lyer_effect() in domain1.md

rules.rule: Wings-OUT (diverging) produces 30-50% stronger effect than wings-IN (converging)
rules.evidence: Day & Dickinson 1976; Biervliet 1896; Heymans 1896

rules.rule: At 90 degrees from body axis, Müller-Lyer effect is zero
rules.evidence: Standard horizontal shoulder seams, perpendicular pocket flaps are perceptually neutral

rules.rule: Gap between design element and body edge (8-18mm) can REVERSE the illusion
rules.evidence: Assimilation -> contrast shift per gap-effect studies

rules.rule: Pattern scale optimal zone: 5-15 repeats across body segment
rules.formula: < 3 repeats: BLOCK effect (-0.3); > 20 repeats: NOISE/Oppel-Kundt (-0.2); 5-15: optimal (+0.1)

rules.rule: Single pattern element > 20% of body segment width triggers figure-ground segregation
rules.formula: width_ratio > 0.20: score -= 0.25

rules.rule: Diagonal lines decompose into H and V components by angle
rules.formula: H_component = cos(theta); V_component = sin(theta); 45deg = equal; 30deg = more Helmholtz; 60deg = more elongation

rules.rule: Downward chevron creates Müller-Lyer contraction at apex
rules.formula: alpha=30deg: ~10% narrowing; 45deg: ~8%; 60deg: ~5%; 90deg: 0%

rules.rule: Attention-to-size conversion factor: 1% fixation shift = 0.3-0.5% perceived size change
rules.formula: size_change_pct = fixation_shift_pct * 0.4
rules.evidence: Derived from Cundall & Guo 2017: 15% fixation shift -> 5-8% width underestimation

rules.rule: Focal point at concern zone produces NEGATIVE score (draws MORE attention)
rules.formula: if focal_zone == concern_zone: score = -0.5 * strength

rules.rule: Loose clothing at waist-hip redirects gaze to legs, producing 1 dress size underestimation
rules.formula: Binary threshold: kicks in at ~4-8cm garment ease beyond body circumference
rules.evidence: Cundall & Guo 2017

rules.rule: Black clothing directs gaze to upper body; white clothing to waist-hip
rules.evidence: Sidhu 2021: black = double duty (irradiation contraction + attention redirection away from waist); white = double damage

rules.rule: Observer awareness suppression: lab data underestimates real-world body scrutiny
rules.evidence: PMC7881876: gaze recording awareness shifts fixation to faces, away from body

rules.rule: Face receives ~20% fixation regardless of clothing; remaining 80% is modulated by garment
rules.evidence: Consolidated from Cornelissen 2009, Cundall & Guo 2017

rules.rule: HVI magnitude: vertical overestimated 5-10% vs equal horizontal in 2D; 7-13% in 3D
rules.evidence: Meta-analysis of 100+ years of data

rules.rule: Width vs height asymmetry: height overestimation (7.1%) > width underestimation (4.5%)
rules.evidence: Thompson & Mikellidou 2011 Exp 1

rules.rule: Frame orientation modulates HVI: horizontal frame gives 3.9% HVI; vertical frame reduces to ~1%
Color break at widest body point increases perceived zone width by +4-8%
rules.formula: Combined: attention redirection (+3.2-4.8%) + HVI column disruption (+1-3%)

rules.rule: High-contrast color break at waist disrupts vertical continuity, reducing HVI by 40-60%
rules.evidence: Sidhu 2021: white increases waist-hip fixation by 8-12%

rules.rule: Garment fit multiplier on L1-L3 illusion effects
rules.formula: bodycon=1.0, fitted=0.85, regular=0.70, relaxed=0.50, loose=0.35, oversized=0.25

rules.rule: Fit as L4 additive: when aligned with L1-3, adds at 0.90x; when conflicting, 50/50 blend
rules.formula: if L4_aligned: total += L4_effect * 0.90; if conflicting: total = 0.5*L1_3 + 0.5*L4

rules.rule: Loose clothing gaze redirection has binary threshold at ~4-8cm ease
rules.evidence: Cundall & Guo 2017

rules.rule: 4-level hierarchical combination with cross-level attenuation
rules.formula: L1: luminance + stripes_partial (synergy 1.44x, ceiling 1.01% on light bg); L2: adds to L1 at 0.92x attenuation (ceiling ±15.37%); L3: adds to L1+L2 at 0.97x; L4: aligned adds at 0.90x, conflicting 50/50 blend

rules.rule: Level 1 synergy: luminance + stripe edge component gives 1.44x boost
rules.evidence: Koutsoumpis Exp 2

rules.rule: Level 1 ceiling: 1.01% on light background, scales to 3.03% on dark background
Background multiplier ranges from 0.15 (white) to 6.5 (very dark)
Percentage to score conversion is asymmetric
rules.formula: if pct <= 0: score = max(-1.0, pct/10.7); if pct > 0: score = min(1.0, pct/15.37)

rules.rule: Color contrast at body transitions: white at waist-hip = double damage
rules.formula: irradiation expansion + attention drawn to widest zone
rules.evidence: Sidhu 2021: white clothing increased waist-hip fixation by 8-12%

rules.rule: Black at waist-hip = double duty: irradiation contraction + attention redirection away
rules.evidence: Sidhu 2021 + Koutsoumpis 2021

rules.rule: Confidence SD envelope increases in transition zone
rules.formula: Helmholtz zone: SD ≈ 3-4%; Transition zone: SD ≈ 5-7% (highest uncertainty); Reversal zone: SD ≈ 9.24% (Imai n=137)

rules.rule: Narrow stripes on wider bodies may preserve Helmholtz deeper into transition zone
rules.evidence: Oppel-Kundt literature: filler parameters shift the maximum

rules.rule: Cultural expectations modulate the perceptual effect (Swami 2012 ecological contradiction)
rules.evidence: Swami real-world: Cohen's d=0.63 widening despite Helmholtz predicting slimming
